required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Tolerability of ABT-869 Versus Sorafenib in Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Randomized Phase 3 Study of the Efficacy and Tolerability of Linifanib (ABT-869) Versus Sorafenib in Subjects With Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to assess the overall survival (OS) of oral linifanib given as monotherapy once daily (QD) compared to sorafenib given twice daily (BID) per standard of care in subjects with advanced or metastatic HCC.

detailed_description.textblock: The IDMC recommended discontinuation of the study, and, the protocol was amended to end study treatment.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until patient death; assessed monthly

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until patient progression; assessed every 6 weeks

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 17.5 mg, Once Daily, Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
Tablets, Oral, 400 mg, Twice Daily, Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Histologic or cytologic diagnosis with unresectable or metastatic HCC
- Child Pugh Class A
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate hematologic, hepatic, and renal function
Exclusion Criteria
- Prior systemic (administered intravenously or orally rather than locoregionally) treatment for HCC
- Prior local therapy (including liver-directed therapy) within 4 weeks from entry
- Untreated brain or meningeal metastases
- Current treatment on another clinical trial
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
